event.title: 7 March 1839, the South Australian Company was granted

data.event: On 7 March 1839, the South Australian Company was granted private subdivision of preliminary section 423.

event.title: became commonly used and around the turn of the century

data.event: Eventually, 'Alberton' became commonly used and around the turn of the century was officially adopted as the suburb's name.
With demand for workers at the Port and homes for these workers needed, late in 1840 there were already 61 houses and 235 residents in Alberton.
St Patrick's Square and Company Square are today still used as public recreation areas (Couper-Smartt, 2003).
